COMMENT_TX: Very cold The diamond appeared damp in spots despite its protection in the past few rainy days under tarpaulin.  Practically every fan was garbed in a winter overcoat. Yankees introduced their new uniform numbers today.
Pipgras had a stretch of 13 pitched balls with just 1 strike

Hit into the crowd in the lower deck of the extension of the LF stands, 492' away. Standing ovation for the Babe; he doffed his cap as he rounded 2B and waved it with great flourish in the direction of his new bride sitting in a box behind 3B.
Hit on the handle of the bat
Gehrig was caught in rundown but made it back to 3B safely. Meusel had also advanced to 3B and was ruled out.
Pinch hitter after 2-1 count to Ruffing
Into RF bleachers; Gehrig doffed his cap to cheering crowd
Berry: pretty catch at the screen
Ruth was served 22 pitches today: 11 called balls, 5 called strikes, 2 missed swings, 1 foul, 1 foul after 2 strikes, 2 fair hits.
Bishop: pretty pickup of hard grounder
Ruth ran back on the RF terrace
Ruth ran back on the RF terrace
Haas lost the high, lazy fly in the sun; after a belated start, Miller almost caught it 20' in front of Haas. Gehrig hustled to 2B with a headlong slide.
